contentrichtext.text: {{no footnotes|date=March 2013}} {{Infobox settlement |official_name = Bunnik <!-- Images and maps -----------> |image_skyline = BunnikNHkerk.jpg |imagesize = 250px |image_alt = A white church with a bricks tower, with some trees in front it |image_caption = The white church in Bunnik |image_flag = Flag of Bunnik.svg |flag_size = 120px |flag_alt = Green flag with a white horizontal band in shape of a wave |image_shield = Bunnik wapen.svg |shield_size = 120px |shield_alt = Shield held by two rapants: an eagle and a lion |image_map = Dutch Municipality Bunnik 2006.png |mapsize = 250px |map_alt = |map_caption = Location of Bunnik in [[Utrecht (province)|Utrecht]], [[Netherlands]] |coordinates_display = inline,title |coordinates_region = NL |subdivision_type = Country |subdivision_name = [[Netherlands]] |subdivision_type1 = Province |subdivision_name1 = [[Utrecht (province)|Utrecht]] |leader_name = H. van Rijnbach-de Groot |leader_party = [[Christian Democratic Appeal|CDA]] |area_footnotes = (2006) |area_total_km2 = 37.57 |area_land_km2 = 36.95 |area_water_km2 = 0.62 |population_as_of = 1 January, 2007 |population_note = Source: [[Statistics Netherlands|CBS]], [http://statline.cbs.nl/ Statline]. |settlement_type = Municipality |population_total = 14168 |population_density_km2 = 383 |elevation_m = 2 |timezone = [[Central European Time|CET]] |utc_offset = +1 |timezone_DST = [[Central European Summer Time|CEST]] |utc_offset_DST = +2 |latd = 52.07 |latNS = N |longd = 5.20 |longEW = E |website = [http://www.bunnik.nl www.bunnik.nl] }} '''Bunnik''' ({{pronunciation|Nl-Bunnik.ogg}}) is a municipality and a village in the [[Netherlands]], in the province of [[Utrecht (province)|Utrecht]]. The recorded history of the village dates back nearly 2000 years, when the [[Ancient Rome|Romans]] constructed a fort at [[Fectio]] (now [[Vechten]]) with a [[harbour]] facing the river [[Rhine]], which marked the border of the [[Roman Empire]]. The fort developed into a thriving trading centre, which continued to exist after the Romans abandoned the fort in the fourth century. Subsequently, the area was occupied by the [[Frisians]] and the [[Franks]]. In the 8th and 9th century the villages of Bunninchem (Bunnik), Lodichem ([[Odijk]]) en Wercundia ([[Werkhoven]]) developed. Chief interests of Bunnik are its surrounding nature, consisting mainly of forests and farmlands. Additionally, Bunnik, hosts the oldest [[Youth Hostel]] in the [[Netherlands]]. ==Population centres == The municipality of Bunnik consists of the following cities, towns, villages and/or districts: Bunnik, [[Odijk]], [[Werkhoven]]. ==Transportation== *[[Bunnik railway station]] == References == * Statistics may have been taken from the [http://www.sdu.nl/staatscourant/gemeentes/gem87u.htm SDU Staatscourant] * For more information, see http://www.bunnik.nl/ == External links== * {{commons category-inline}} * [http://www.plattegronden.nl/bunnik/index.html A map of Bunnik] * [http://www.plattegronden.nl/gemeentebunnik/index.html A map of the entire municipality] * [http://www.livius.org/fa-fn/fectio/fectio.html Livius.org: Vechten (Fectio)] {{Geographic location | Centre = Bunnik | North = [[Zeist]] | East = [[Utrechtse Heuvelrug]] | Southeast = [[Wijk bij Duurstede]] | Southwest = [[Houten]] | Northwest = [[Utrecht]] }} {{Utrecht Province}} [[Category:Municipalities of Utrecht (province)]] [[Category:Populated places in Utrecht (province)]] {{Utrecht-geo-stub}}
